intro: Chrysopsis rutteri, commonly known as the Rutter's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark brown disk florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the spring. Chrysopsis rutteri is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
